intro: Brunfelsia calycina f. grandiflora, commonly known as the grandiflora Brunfelsia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshade plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple, often with a contrasting white or yellow throat. It produces small, fleshy berries that are edible when ripe. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and attractive foliage.
